A masterpiece of world building and story development, with a captivating world, memorable characters and solid level design with graphics that have aged well.

Gameplay mechanics are top-notch. The sound is unique from any other, and very satisfying when you land your shots. Gameplay is fun, though the dreaded Jeep levels are the worst in my opinion since the car has horrible controls, next to the boat levels.

Oh, and R.I.P Laszlo. The finest mind of his generation. You'll get the joke when you play it yourself.

One of the best. Definitely Valve's doing!
Edit: Never mind, Valve sucks.

Rise and shine Mr. Freeman, rise and shine...

* Pros
+ Good story
+ Likable characters
+ The entirety of the "We don't go to Ravenholm" level
+ Good use of physics engine with puzzles/combat
+ Every level feels different (sorta)
+ Character banter is great and can be pretty funny
+ Alyx can handle herself in escort sections
+ Dog

* Cons
- Combat is hit or miss
- The the guns feel very weak
- No real enemy variety
- Not many unique/alien weapons like Half-Life 1 (except gravity gun of course)
- The game takes a little bit to get going
- Replayability is pretty low (cut scenes after second playthrough felt like a complete drag)
- The vehicle sections are too long
- The game is hyped up way too much (Half-Life 1 is better don't @ me)

Overall: 8/10 Really Good

Half-Life 2 is a timeless classic created by VALVe in their peak time.

This game is literally my FAVOURITE game of all time. No other game I've played in my whole life comes anywhere near beating this one. Everything about this game is so fantastic, from the absolutely CRAZY and extremely AMAZING story line to the incredibly immersive atmosphere, perfectly generated by ambiences like those of City 17's. This game is worth absolutely every cent and I am SO disappointed that I barely played it when I originally bought it back in 2013. It's never too late to become a fan of the Half-Life series, and why WOULDN'T you want to be apart of a game that changed the gaming industry forever?

Thank you VALVe, and we're all still waiting for what happens after the end of Episode 2 >;(. Anyway, this is (in my opinion) the world's best game.
the game of my soul ..  nothing more to say !!

One of the best PC games of all time. 10/10.
its ok, i guess

One of the best games I've ever played, not necessarily due to mechanics (which are good actually) or graphics (good for its time of release) but thanks to the fact that the story line and the progression of the story is extremely well. Concept design is very good. There are some loopholes in the story (like a few cliche confrontations and that there are about no security cameras for a civ that has a very developed tech) however it was still very engaging and entertaining. Character development was amazing. There were interesting and unexpected events (even jokes). If i could give a number, I'd give this game a solid 10/10.

TLDR: The game is amazing. I regret not playing this game much much earlier. I now understand why people want a HL3. But this amazing story can be left as is, since it can be considered complete.

This is a great game, unless you don't like cliff-hangers.

It's Half Life 2. Steam pretty much exists because of this game. No really, The Orange Box was such an amazing deal because it was designed to convince people to join Steam. Steam Sales were amazing deals to get people to join Steam. Valve exists because Steam does well. Steam has done so well that Valve hasn't made a game half as good as Half Life 2 since 2012 and they're still one of the top names in the video game industry.

So if you ever wonder why there isn't a Half Life 3, it's because Half Life 2 sold so well, that Valve no longer needs to make games to make money. No risks. Just Steam.
